meanings.definition: A unit of digital information equal to 1,024 bytes.
meanings.sent1: My computer can store many kilobytes of pictures.
meanings.sent2: The email attachment was too large, it exceeded a few kilobytes.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fit a whole movie into just a few kilobytes, but it turned out to be a pixelated mess.
meanings.sent4: Her brain processed information at lightning speed, consuming kilobytes of data in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The tiny USB drive held thousands of kilobytes, like a digital treasure chest.

meanings.definition: The amount of data that can be stored or transmitted in kilobytes.
meanings.sent1: The website loaded quickly because it only required a few kilobytes of data.
meanings.sent2: He measured the file size in kilobytes before sending it over the internet.
meanings.sent3: The cat video was so funny, it must have contained a couple of kilobytes of pure joy.
meanings.sent4: Her voice carried kilobytes of emotion, touching everyone who listened.
meanings.sent5: The old computer struggled to process the modern game's kilobytes of graphics.
